snippet: As Hamid Karzai’s days as Afghanistan’s president draw to a close, his family members are trying to protect their status while secretly fighting among themselves over the fortune they have amassed.
abstract: Family members of Hamid Karzai, whose days as president of Afghanistan are drawing to an end, are trying to protect their status while secretly fighting among themselves over the fortune they have amassed; looming withdrawal of American and NATO troops by 2014 from the still unresolved war is causing anxiety within the Afghan elite who have been among the war’s biggest beneficiaries, enriching themselves from American military contracts, insider business deals with foreign companies, government corruption and narcotics trafficking.
lead_paragraph: As Hamid Karzai’s days as Afghanistan’s president draw to a close, his family members are trying to protect their status while secretly fighting among themselves over the fortune they have amassed.

headline.seo: Karzai Family Moves to Protect Its Privilege
headline.main: Intrigue in Karzai Family as an Afghan Era Closes
headline.print_headline: Intrigue in Karzai Family As an Afghan Era Closes
